commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: The gyoza we ate the other day was really good. I bet there's so many other good foods in Japan.

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Swiss food seems yummy, too. Cheese, sausage, potatoes... I wish I could eat it all with some white rice!

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: Umi, are you interested in acting on stage? I was impressed by your karaoke performance, so I'd love go on stage with you some time.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: A-Acting?! I could never! Us, on stage together?! Was I scouted by an acting troupe? I-I-I can't! I couldn't!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: Eli, your skin is so nice. It's fair and smooth, like a field of fresh snow that not a single being has stepped foot in.

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Eek! That's a little embarrassing... You sure know how to splash color on your words.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: You. Guys! What are you doing having a fun little chat?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: They got closer through competing with each other last week.

commands.speaker: Setsuna
commands.line: A friendship blooming from fierce fighting. What a thrilling development!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: I don't remember anyone fighting.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Forget about that! We're rivals! Enemies! We're at war here, can't you see?! There's no need to be friendly!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Come on, Nico-chi. Idols shouldn't get so angry. Besides, they do say yesterday's enemy is today's best friend.

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: That wasn't yesterday, it was a whole week ago.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nico is right about us fighting each other. We lost the other day, but we're going to win this time.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: We might even see μ's crying in shame at the end of all this. You might want to get some extra towels ready.

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: Kasumi, I think you're provoking them too much.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: *Yawn* What are we doing today, anyway?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: That's for you to find out when it starts! Now, let's do just that!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: All right! Let's get pumped!

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: Super pumped!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Don't get all crazy together!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Time for μ's VS Nijigasaki, round four! A test of nerves!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: School idols need wills of steel to withstand anything that could happen while performing in front of so many people. So, we're going to compete with that.

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Nozomi will be competing for μ's.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Let's do it!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nijigasaki will put out... Kanata, do your best!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Mmm. Just leave everything to me.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: What's this test of nerves though? We exploring a graveyard at night or something?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Close, but not quite. We'll be using this to compete!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: A DVD...? Wait, I know this movie. I've seen people on TV and the internet talk about how scary it is. I get it! The person who's more scared loses, right?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Exactly. Nozomi and Kanata-- Hey, don't sleep while standing! Both of you wrap this around your wrists during the movie.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: What's this?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: A device that measures your heartbeat. We can see the data from an app on our phones, so there's no pretending you're fine!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That's very thorough.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Let's start it then. Who has stronger nerves? Begin!

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: W-W-Wait, why is she opening the door?! There's definitely a ghost in there! Why doesn't she know?!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Sh-Shut up! If she doesn't open the door, there's no mo-- EEEEK!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: I can't watch! I definitely can't!

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: Eeeek! Why is it so fast even crawling on all fours?! It's gonna catch-- Eeeeeek!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: What? Can't you just smack it in the face or something?

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: I doubt that'd have much effect on this thing!

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: Hm, I think everyone getting so excited is making it less scary for me.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Nozomi and Kanata don't look that scared. How are their heartbeats?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Umm... Nozomi has some fluctuations, but it's not that different from before they started watching. Kanata...

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Wh-Whoa. It hasn't changed at all.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You're right! Wow, Kanata.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: (Wait, is Kanata...?)

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: The contest of nerves goes to... Kanata Konoe!

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: Yay...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Kanata, be a little more excited!

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: She can't help it, she just woke up!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: What kind of nerves does it take to be able to sleep among such commotion?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: It was impressive. There was a super scary scene right before you went to sleep. Didn't it scare you at all?

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: You stay so composed in the face of such fear, among such commotion and excitement. We don't have someone like you in our group.

commands.speaker: Kanata
commands.line: *Giggle* Thanks for the compliment.

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: B-But sleeping isn't fair! The contest was supposed to be about the movie being scary or not!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: Don't sweat the small stuff! A win is a win. Or, do you want to watch it again?

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: I-I don't know about that.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: That makes it two to two. A tie!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Hmm, too bad!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: We won't lose next time.
